cards.caption: Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum

sections: Make a donation with the Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum using promo code M5 and receive 25 percent extra bonus tickets.

tops your dream car list, you may want to check out this sweepstakes that is being held by the Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum. A donation to the museum in Auburn, Indiana, will put you into the sweepstakes to take home one epic grand prize - a
numbers-matching 1963 Chevrolet Corvette Sting Ray Convertible

. This beautiful classic Sting Ray could be in your garage as early as next month! All proceeds will benefit the museum which will go toward preserving Auburn, Cord and Duesenberg vehicles along with the history.
Readers of Motorious will receive an exclusive discount
, and at checkout and receive 25 percent more bonus tickets. This sweepstakes ends on September 7th, and then this beautiful

Finished in a stunning Daytona Blue over a matching blue interior, this gorgeous '63 Corvette comes with a hardtop to protect the soft convertible top. Powering this classic is a numbers-matching 327-cubic-inch V8 engine generating 300-horsepower, and a four-speed manual transmission twists a Positraction rear end stuffed with 3.08 gears. Inside, the car retains the factory AM/FM radio ready to play your favorite station.

Auburn, Cord and Duesenberg were automakers that built vehicles for pure luxury. The cars were not mass produced on an assembly line like many others as each one was hand-assembled. Appropriately, the museum is located where the old Auburn Automobile Company's former headquarters once was in Auburn, Indiana. All three of auto companies closed up shop back in 1937, and the museum opened up on July 6th, 1974. The museum houses 140 vintage and antique vehicles and draws in over 40,000 visitors a year. In fact, the museum is a National Historic Landmark as it was named by the U.S. National Parks Service in 2005. Making a donation to the museum - that will enter you into the sweepstakes to win one
- will ensure that many will be able to enjoy this place for years to come.

Even better, the Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum is a non-profit organization. That means your donation(s) to the museum should be tax deductible, but make sure to consult with your tax professional. Any donation is appreciated, but packages are offered starting with 3 tickets for $25. Of course, higher donations still include 25 percent more raffle tickets so make sure
checkout and increase your chances to win one incredible
. The minimum raised for the car to be given away was $100,000, but according to the website almost double has been raised at $181,775!
This sweepstakes ends on September 7th, and then this beautiful
will be given away as a grand prize to one lucky winner.
